title: (x) Fighting for a place in the team - Eagle Bold {Yves}
content:
![Fighting for a place in the team](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12377.jpg)   
   
Any ideas what this is?   
Its used in the UK edition of Cycle Sport magazine, but I don't think its in the US edition.   
   
Thanks

 [‹ (x) Numbers for letters - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/499 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) enter Guinness.com - Bell Gothic (Peter) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/504 "Go to next forum topic")
author: steve_p

comments.content:
[Bureau Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=105704989315589785&fontname=Eagle) Bold from [the Font Bureau, Inc.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.fontbureau.com/)   
   
The Eagle series realizes the ideas behind   
 [Morris Fuller Benton](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.identifont.com/show?16W)'s famous titling, Eagle Bold,   
the symbol of American recovery, drawn in 1933   
for the National Recovery Association. Font Bureau   
Eagle was started in 1989 for Publish. [David Berlow](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.fontbureau.com/people/person.tpl?cart=105704989315589785&designer=David%20Berlow)  
designed a lowercase, finished the character set,   
and in 1990 added Eagle Book for setting text.   
In 1994, [Jonathan Corum](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.fontbureau.com/people/person.tpl?cart=105704989315589785&designer=Jonathan%20Corum) added Eagle Light and   
Eagle Black to form a full series; FB 1989-94
I think 1 minute is still the record ? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) But I can't remeber who holds it? Is it Yves?

[Hrant](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/6469.html) still holds the record, though [Stephen](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4618.html?1043231477), Dave,   
 [Tiff](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4845.html) and [I](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/5290.html) came pretty close a couple of times. (Sorry   
Chesh, couldn't find the link for your February 3rd   
3-minuter).

_February_ 3-minuter? Boy, it looks like the [one I had two weeks ago](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175613/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11920.html?1055983174) went by too fast for ya...   
   
Still haven't beaten Hrant's 1-minuter, though.   
   
..._yet._

Sorry about that, Chesh. I did an advanced search on   
"minutes", so that's why I missed your recent instant ID.   
I profusely apologize I didn't go as far as to check every   
single ID from the past 2 years. =D ;)
